conflicts.conflict_text: Under Policy POL-REFUND-005, designated as company priority, agents must offer a refund when the customer has a receipt (has_receipt == True) and the purchase was made within fourteen days (days_since_purchase <= 14); however, if physical damage is present (physical_damage == True), agents must deny the refund regardless of receipt status or purchase date. As a low-priority department exception, when the customer does not have a receipt (has_receipt == False), standard Policy POL-REFUND-005 behavior shall be overridden.

Policy POL-SEC-002 (department priority) mandates that agents must verify_identity when refund_amount >= 400; however, a low-priority department exception applies whereby if refund_amount <= 400, standard behavior for POL-SEC-002 shall be overridden.

Policy POL-PRIVACY-006 (department priority) establishes that when contains_pii == True, agents must disclose_pii; however, a low-priority department exception applies whereby when contains_pii == False, standard behavior for POL-PRIVACY-006 shall be overridden.

Policy POL-SHIP-018 (department priority) establishes that when item_in_stock == True, agents must ship_within_48h; however, if severe_weather_alert == True, then allow_delay is permitted as an exception to the 48-hour shipping requirement. As a low-priority department exception, when item_in_stock == False, standard behavior for POL-SHIP-018 shall be overridden.

Policy POL-SEC-017 (company priority) mandates that agents must verify_identity when refund_amount >= 400; however, a low-priority department exception applies whereby if refund_amount <= 400, standard behavior for POL-SEC-017 shall be overridden.

Under Policy POL-REFUND-010, agents must offer a refund when the customer has a receipt (has_receipt == True) and the purchase was made within 21 days (days_since_purchase <= 21); however, if physical damage is present (physical_damage == True), agents must deny the refund regardless of receipt status or purchase date. As a low-priority department exception to this policy, when the customer does not have a receipt (has_receipt == False), standard Policy POL-REFUND-010 behavior shall be overridden.

Policy POL-PRIVACY-011 (situational priority) shall govern the handling of personally identifiable information as follows: when contains_pii equals True, agents must execute disclose_pii; however, a low-priority department exception applies whereby when contains_pii equals False, standard behavior for POL-PRIVACY-011 shall be overridden.

Under Policy POL-RETURNS-019, agents must offer a refund when the customer has a receipt (has_receipt == True) and the purchase was made within 28 days (days_since_purchase <= 28); however, if physical damage is present (physical_damage == True), agents must deny the refund regardless of receipt status or purchase date. As a low-priority department exception, when the customer does not have a receipt (has_receipt == False), standard Policy POL-RETURNS-019 behavior shall be overridden.

When handling security requests, the standard protocol requires that refund_amount must be greater than or equal to 400 for the request to be considered valid - so if someone's asking for $500 back, that's going to trigger the verify_identity process.
